title: Halp! My alpha desktop icon is missing
body:
**Update - 11/27: **Hey guys, this issue should now be fixed and next time you launch League, you'll be prompted to update your desktop icon. This also means using the updated desktop icon will directly launch the updated client without having to go through the old patcher. Please let us know if you're still having issues with your desktop icon.

***

Hey guys, we've discovered an issue with User Access Control on Windows (the pop up thing that asks you for confirmation whenever you make a change) that is preventing the alpha client from updating  the alpha desktop icon which ends up just removing it from your desktop. (legacy icon is not affected) So after updating your alpha client to 6.22, you may have noticed that your icon is missing from your desktop. 

This will be fixed once we go to open beta (soon) but in the meantime, the workaround is locating the LeagueClient executable in your install folder and creating a new shortcut for alpha from there. Apologies for not catching this sooner T_T

**IMPORTANT: **_Please do not try to uninstall or reinstall alpha or delete any files from your League of Legends install folder. This will cause bugsplats and will require you to reinstall legacy client and alpha from scratch._

>User Access Control

_Should be "Account", but anyway._
_User_ Access _Control gotta be a chastity belt._ xD

But lets see now; UAC...let's just study that acronym for a moment...
...
...
[Yes, indeed something very nice](http://doom.wikia.com/wiki/Union_Aerospace_Corporation).

Why on Earth (or Mars) would the real one be any better? In a PC's beginning of life, the first part is very easily set:
1. Install Windows
2. Disable User Account Control
3. Install drivers
4. Irrelevant

It's point number 2 that really interests us here today. And the question is: What kind of PC user would use their PC (ehm, duh) with that horrendous piece of software activated?
We are talking Shaco levels of royal annoyance here! It is the digital equivalent of having a boot showed up the bumhole! With the owner of the boot being Volibear.

"Do you want to open this program?" - [Clicks Yes]
"Are you sure you want to open this program?" - [Firmly clicks Yes]
"Are you absolutely sure you want to open this program?" - [Spamming Yes, crying and screaming, throws stuff around, and in a brief moment of inner peace googles how to turn that damn POS off!!]

Wikipedia actually got it spot-on:

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/doom/images/8/82/E1m4_uaclogo.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080507124740

^ That's exactly what should be done with it

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/4/44/Windows_7_UAC_Signedcode.png https://rmactsc.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/dd478.jpg http://www.anaitgames.com/images/avatar/deltamono.jpg

So the moral of the story is: as I have turned that #"¤%!§ off, as any sane being would, how come my icon was thieved as well?

Oh well, it doesn't matter now - click "legacy client" and play Ascension.
